description: Part two and three storey extension to public house to provide 31 bedroom hotel with staff accommodation in roof with bridge link to adjoining car park (revised application)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with Adopted UDP Policy B1 and replacement UDP Policy 5.5. | No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscaping works, including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area. in accordance with adopted UDP Policy B2 and replacement UDP Policy 4.5. | The use of the premises shall be restricted to use as a hotel only and shall only be used in association with the adjoining public house.  REASON: To ensure that the use is consistent with its surroundings, has adequate facilities on site  and does not cause harm to the living conditions of neighbouring residents in accordance with adopted UDP Policies B5, B8 and E18 and replacement UDP Policy 6.7 | The new hotel courtyard shall not be used in association with the adjoining public house or for any other outdoor recreational or amenity purpose other than as a sitting out area for hotel residents and there shall be no other access to it other than for maintenance purposes.  The area of land shall be landscaped in accordance with details which shall first be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before the use hereby permitted first commences and shall be so retained thereafter. REASON: To prevent unacceptable disturbance to neighbours and to protect the appearance of the Haven Green Conservation Area in accordance with adopted UDP Policies B2 and B5 and replacement UDP Policies 4.5 and 6.7. | No additional openings shall be created in the north, east and west elevations of the building and no plant or machinery shall be installed anywhere on site outside the building without the express permission of the local planning authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.  REASON: To protect the privacy of neighbouring residents and the quiet enjoyment of their homes in accordance with adopted UDP Policy B5 and replacement UDP Policy 6.7. | The hotel or any part thereof hereby permitted shall not be used until the pedestrian link bridge between the premises and the multi-storey car park shown on the drawing ref. 354/01C together with any associated signage has been constructed and made available for use. Once opened it shall be kept permanently available for use.  REASON: To ensure that the use does not give rise to disturbance to neighbouring occupiers, that there is adequate access to car parking and in the interests of pedestrian and highway safety in accordance with adopted UDP Policies T54 and B5 and replacement UDP Policies 9.1 and 6.7. | No loading or unloading by delivery vehicles serving the site shall take place except between the hours of 0800 to 1800 Monday to Friday (excluding public holidays) and 0900 to 1300 on Saturdays. REASON: To prevent unacceptable disturbance to neighbouring residents in accordance with adopted UDP Policy B5 and replacement UDP Policy 6.7. | The hotel shall be laid out in accordance with the floor plans and elevations hereby approved, including the glass block windows on the north and west elevations, before it is first brought into use and permanently retained as such. REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring residents in accordance with adopted UDP Policy B5 and replacement UDP Policy 6.7. | The proposed refuse storage arrangements shown on the approved floor plans shall be implemented before the hotel is first brought into use and permanently retained. REASON: To prevent unacceptable disturbance to neighbouring residents in accordance with adopted UDP Policy B5 and replacement UDP Policy 6.7. | Access to and from the hotel (except for emergency purposes) after 2300 hours and before 0800 hours on any day shall be via the bridge from the Springbridge multi-storey car park only and all other entrances shall be kept locked during those hours  REASON: To prevent unacceptable disturbance to neighbouring residents in accordance with adopted UDP Policy B5 and replacement UDP Policies 6.7. | Prior to commencement of development, details of security measures for the building and car/cycle parking area (including lighting) aiming to comply with the London Borough of Ealing Supplementary Planning Guidance 8 - Safer Ealing shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The works shall be carried out as approved prior to the use of any part of the development and shall be permanently retained.  REASON: In the interest of the safety and security of the premises and its users, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policy B20; Replacement UDP policy 4.4. | Notwithstanding the information contained in the application, prior to commencement of works on site, a Travel Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and shall be implemented and complied with thereafter. Targets within the plan shall be subject to monitoring by the local planning authority on an annual basis or timetable to be agreed with the local planning authority.  REASON: To minimise car use and promote alternative modes of travel to and from the site in accordance with the Council+s sustainable development policies 9.1, 9.11, 9.12, T56 and T63. | No development shall take place until details of the layout of at least one hotel bedroom so as to be suitable for use by people with disabilities and details showing how the courtyard is to be made accessible to and usable by people with disabilities have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The details so approved shall be carried out as approved prior to the first occupation of any part of the development and permanently retained. REASON: To meet the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with adopted UDP Policies B6 ES1, ES3 and E17 and replacement UDP Policies 4.3 and 6.7. | No development shall take place until details of the external lighting have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details so approved shall be installed as approved prior to the first occupation of any part of the development and permanently retained in compliance with the approved specification.  REASON: To prevent unacceptable disturbance to neighbouring residents in accordance with adopted UDP Policy B5 and replacement UDP Policy 6.7. | No development shall take place until details of measures for rainwater harvesting and reuse within the development have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The details so approved shall be installed as approved prior to the first occupation of any part of the development and permanently retained.  REASON: To ensure the Council's policies on sustainability are met in accordance with replacement UDP Policy 2.5. | The cycle parking provision shown on the approved plans shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation of the new dwellings, and retained permanently.  REASON: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists in accordance with Adopted UDP policies T15 and T40 and replacement UDP policies 9.1, 9.6 and Appendix One. | The proposed ground floor windows in the north and west elevation of the building approved shall contain only obscure glass and shall be permanently fixed shut. A sample of the obscured glass, no smaller than 300 mm square shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development, and the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the sample thus approved.  The details so approved shall be retained permanently.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with adopted UDP Policy B5 and replacement UDP Policy 6.7. | The screening framework around the upper floor north facing windows shall be installed before the development is first brought into use and shall be permanently retained.  REASON: To prevent unacceptable disturbance to neighbouring residents in accordance with adopted UDP Policy B5 and replacement UDP Policy 6.7. | Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before any development is commenced, to demonstrate that the composite sound reduction index of the building envelope, Rw, will achieve the following criteria with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided:  The background L90,15min linear noise level in any one third octave band from 50Hz to 160 Hz, and also the overall Linear L90 level, as previously measured at 1 m from the nearest fatade of the nearest affected premises, shall not be increased when the amplified music or speech is played and the measurement is repeated in the same position using L90 linear over any 5 minute period with the background and source operating together.  REASON: To prevent unacceptable disturbance to neighbouring residents in accordance with adopted UDP Policies B8 and ES5; and replacement UDP Policy 4.11. | Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, for a suitable mechanical ventilation system, to ensure doors and windows are kept closed during hot weather and externally sited ventilation plant associated with this system will be silenced to a standard not exceeding NR 35 Leq,5min (2300 - 0700hrs), measured or calculated at 1m from the nearest facade of the nearest affected noise sensitive premises.  REASON: To prevent unacceptable disturbance to neighbouring residents in accordance with adopted UDP Policies B8 and ES5; and replacement UDP Policy 4.11. | Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, for a suitable sound limiting device to control the output from the amplification system to a maximum noise level agreed with this the Authority.  The limiter device shall also be connected to all external doors so that the power to the amplifiers will be cut if a door is opened, other than for means of escape from fire.  REASON: To prevent unacceptable disturbance to neighbouring residents in accordance with adopted UDP Policies B8 and ES5; and replacement UDP Policy 4.11.
